alert.note: Alert for Broome; Chemung; Chenango; Cortland; Tioga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 18 at 3:05PM EST until February 19 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by ice jams continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central New York and northeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, in central New York, Broome, Chemung, Chenango, Cortland and Tioga. In northeast Pennsylvania, Bradford, Luzerne and Wyoming. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Newly forming ice jams could cause creeks and streams to rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Significant amounts of ice remain in area rivers and have begun to move downstream on the Chenango, Tioughnioga and Susquehanna rivers. Areas closest to these rivers may experience flooding if new ice jams take hold. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
